Description.val: This line item funds modifications to the E-6 Mercury aircraft to improve mission capability and readiness.  All sixteen (16) aircraft in the E-6 fleet will receive each modification.  The E-6 is a manned airborne communications platform designed to provide a survivable, endurable, and reliable airborne Command and Control Communications capability in support of the President, Secretary of Defense and United States strategic and non-strategic forces.  Mission Support [Operational, Safety and Improvement Program (OSIP) 007-02] enables production prototype aircraft support.  Safety Deficiencies (OSIP 008-02) corrects high risk aircraft safety hazards to protect personnel and equipment enabling mission readiness.  Tech Insertion (OSIP 003-04) corrects aircraft obsolescence, supportability, weight management and interoperability deficiencies through new technology insertion enabling mission readiness.  Communications Upgrade (OSIP 012-07) installs expanded aircraft communication bandwidth capability required to improve airborne command post operations.  Service Life Extension Program (OSIP 003-07) extends the service life of the aircraft to 2040+ through airframe strengthening and structural data recording and analysis.  Block I (OSIP 008-10) corrects airborne command post operational test deficiencies to improve mission capability and readiness.  Multi-Role Tactical Common Data Link (OSIP 013-10) installs expanded aircraft communication bandwidth capability required to interoperate with United States Strategic Command's distributed National Command and Control Architecture.  Auxiliary Power Unit (APU) (OSIP 002-12) corrects airborne command post operational test deficiencies by installing an improved APU to meet increased aircraft power requirements.  Family of Advanced Beyond-Line-of-Sight Terminals/Presidential and National Voice Conferencing (FAB-T/PNVC) (OSIP 014-14) replaces obsolete Military Strategic Tactical Relay terminals with improved FAB-T, and installs PNVC to provide specialized secure voice capability over the strategic Advanced Extremely High Frequency satellite communications system.

Justification.val:
The Family of Advanced Beyond-Line-of-Sight Terminals/Presidential and National Voice Conferencing (FAB-T/PNVC)
modification is moved from the Multi-Role Tactical Common Data Link OSIP 013-10 (formerly Block II) to a new OSIP 014-14(FAB-T/PNVC) which starts in FY14.
.

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION:  The Mission Support program addresses Aircraft Systems supportability, obsolescence and system update issues.  

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES:  Other support in FY12 was predominiantly aircraft support.  

Note: The GPS effort was moved from Mission Support OSIP 007-02 to the Tech Insertion OSIP 003-04.

Name.@footnote: Increase in Other Support cost growth in FY13 is due to Blankets Phase 2 Equipment effort beginning in FY13.  Increase in Other Support cost growth in FY17 and FY18 is for continued support for emergent aircraft safety hazards to enable mission readiness.
Increase in cost growth in FY13 - FY18 is due to the Kapton 1A Kit's small unit cost, in which even a small increase will be more than the OSD inflation rate allows.
Increase in cost growth in FY13, FY14, FY15, and FY17 is due to the FQIS program's small unit cost, in which even a small increase will be more than the OSD inflation rate allows.
Increase in cost growth in FY14 is due to the Blanket Phase 2 Equipment's small unit cost, in which even a small increase will be more than the OSD inflation rate allows.

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION:  Safety Deficiencies corrects high risk aircraft safety hazards to protect personnel and equipment enabling mission readiness.  Federal agency directives, aging aircraft material condition, and the operational environment generate safety hazards for correction.  Modifications include, but not limited to: Fuel Quantity Indicating System (FQIS) installation; Aircraft Acoustic Thermal Blankets replacement; Kapton wiring replacement; Crash Survivable Flight Incident Recorder System (CSFIR) Phase 1 ground software; and other safety deficiencies that require correction. 

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES: FQIS non-recurring engineering completed in FY10 with production kit buys and installations in FY11 - FY17 (16 A/C); Acoustic Thermal Blanket Phase 2, 1 install kit complete in FY12; 4 kit buys in FY13 and FY14 with installation in FY13 through FY15 (5 A/C); Aircraft Kapton Wire kit buys and installs in FY13 to beyond Future Year's Defense Plan (FYDP) (16 A/C).

Name.@footnote: Increase in Data cost growth in FY15 is to support the start of the GPS effort.
Increase in Training Equipment cost in FY15 is to support the start of the GPS and Seats efforts.
Increase in ILS cost in FY15 is to support the start of the GPS and Seats efforts.
Increase in Other Support cost growth in FY14 is due to the Seats effort beginning in FY14.  Increase in Other Support cost growth in FY18 is due to Keyers and CVLR efforts beginning in FY18.

Increase in Installation Kits N/R cost for FY13 is due to the Seats program non-recurring effort beginning in FY13 in support of a production buy in FY14.  Increase in Installation Kits N/R cost for FY17 is due to the HPTS and HFALE programs non-recurring effort beginning in FY17 to support a production buy in the same year.  Increase in Installation Kits N/R cost for FY18 is due to the Keyers, CVLR, CNS/ATM and MOM programs non-recurring effort beginning in FY18, with NRE kit buys in FY18 for Keyers and CVLR and NRE Kit buys beyond the FYDP for CNS/ATM and MOM.

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION:  Tech Insertion corrects aircraft obsolescence, supportability, weight management and interoperability deficiencies through new technology insertion enabling mission readiness.  Unsupportable computing technology, communication systems, interoperability gaps, and the need to maintain aircraft range and endurance through weight reduction generates mission critical modification requirements.  Modifications include: KG-3X; CRYPTO Modernization; Brakes; Seats; Glare Shield; High Power Transmit Set (HPTS); HPTS Camera; Global Positioning System (GPS); High Frequency Automatic Link Establishment (HF ALE); Keyers; Compact Very Low Frequency (CVLF) receiver; Communication Navigation and Surveillance Air Traffic Management (CNS/ATM); Missions Operation Monitor (MOM).

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES:  KG3X installs completed in FY12.   CRYPTO Modernization NRE started in FY11; production kit buys in FY12 - FY13 with installs in FY13 - FY14 (16 A/C). Brakes non-recurring engineering (NRE) install bought; to be installed in FY13; production install kit buys in FY13-15 with installs in FY13-FY15 (16 A/C).  Seats NRE install kit buy in FY13 with installation in FY14; production install kit buys and installation in FY14 and FY15 (16 A/C).  Glare Shield NRE kit buys in FY14 with kit buys and installation in FY14-FY16.   HPTS Camera NRE FY14-FY17; production kit buys in FY15-FY16; Installs in FY15-FY16; GPS kit buys and installations in FY15 (16 A/C).  HPTS NRE FY16 with NRE kit buy FY17 and installation FY18; production kit buys FY18 and beyond the Future Years Defense Plan (FYDP) and installs beyond the FYDP (16 A/C).  HF ALE system NRE and NRE kit buy in FY17 with installation in FY18; production kit buys in FY18 to beyond the FYDP with installs beyond the FYDP (16 A/C).  Keyers NRE and NRE kit buy in FY18 with installation in FY18; production kit buys in FY18 to beyond the FYDP with installation in FY18 to beyond the FYDP (16 A/C).  CVLF NRE FY18 and beyond the FYDP with NRE kit buy and installation in FY18; production kit buys FY18 to beyond the FYDP with installs beyond the FYDP (16 A/C).  CNS/ATM NRE FY18 with kit buys and installations beyond the FYDP (16/AC).   MOM NRE FY18 with kit buys and installations beyond the FYDP (16A/C).  

Note: The GPS effort was moved from Mission Support OSIP 007-02 to the Tech Insertion OSIP 003-04.

Name.@footnote: Increase in Other Support cost growth in FY15 is to support the Installation N/R CSFIRS contract award in FY16.
Increase in SLEP Phase One Kit cost growth in FY16 is due to projected increase in the number of days required to complete a SLEP aircraft.
Increase in Installation Kits N/R cost for FY17 is due to the CSFIRs program non-recurring effort continuing in FY17 in support of a production buy in FY18.

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION:  Service Life Extension Program (SLEP) extends the service life of the aircraft to 2040+ through airframe strengthening and structural data recording and analysis.  Just in time modifications to prevent aircraft grounding due to fatigue life expended.  Modifications include, but not limited to: SLEP; Crash Survivable Flight Incident Recorder (CSFIR) Phase 2; Individual Aircraft Tracking System (IATS).

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES:  SLEP Installation Kit production buys in FY09 to FY16 (16 A/C) with installs in FY09 to FY16 (16 A/C).  CSFIR Phase 2 non-recurring engineering (NRE) in FY16-FY18 with NRE kit buy in FY18 and production kit buys beyond the FYDP (16 A/C); installations beyond the FYDP (16A/C). IATS NRE in FY16-FY18 with installs beyond the FYDP.

Name.@footnote: Increase in Data cost growth in FY13 is to support the continued efforts of IP Phase 1&3 Kits and Equipment.
Increase in Training Equipment cost in FY14 is to support the IP Phase 1 training efforts.
Increase in Other Support cost growth in FY14-FY17 is due to the projected cost growth to support the IP Phase 1&3 efforts.
Increase in IP Phase 1 cost growth in FY13-FY17 is due to the projected unit cost growth to align with the schedule of the Block I effort (OSIP 008-10).
Increase in IP Phase 3 cost growth in FY13-FY17 is due to the projected unit cost growth to align with the schedule of the Block I effort (OSIP 008-10).
Increase in IP Phase 1 Equipment cost growth in FY13-FY17 is due to the projected unit cost growth to align with the schedule of the Block I effort (OSIP 008-10).
Increase in IP Phase 3 Equipment cost growth in FY13-FY17 is due to the projected unit cost growth to align with the schedule of the Block I effort (OSIP 008-10).

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION:  Communications Upgrade installs expanded aircraft communication bandwidth capability required to improve airborne command post operations.  Internet Protocol (IP) connectivity and wideband communication capability to enable voice, video and data services is mission critical to command and control operations.  Modifications include: IP Phase I, International Marine/Maritime Satellite (INMARSAT); IP Phase 3, removal of Utility Trailing Wire Antenna (UTWA). 

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES:  IP Phase 1 INMARSAT non-recurring engineering (NRE) FY07-FY09 with NRE kit installation in FY09.  Phase 1 production kit buys in FY10-FY17 with installs FY11-FY18 (16 A/C). IP Phase 3 UTWA removal NRE FY07-FY08 with NRE kit install in FY09.  Phase 3 aircraft production kit buys in FY10-FY17 with installs in FY11-FY18 (16 A/C).  IP Phases 1 and 3 installations will be completed concurrently with the Block I production program in FY12 through FY18.

Name.@footnote: Increase in Block I Data cost growth in FY14 is per the Independent Cost Estimate (ICE) completed for the Gate 6 Full Rate Production (FRP) Decision Review which was approved on May 1, 2012.

Increase in Block I Training Equipment cost growth in FY13, FY14 and FY18 is per the Independent Cost Estimate (ICE) completed for the Gate 6 Full Rate Production (FRP) Decision Review which was approved on May 1, 2012.
Increase in Block I Other Support cost growth in FY13 is per the Independent Cost Estimate (ICE) completed for the Gate 6 Full Rate Production (FRP) Decision Review which was approved on May 1, 2012.

Increase in Block I Kit unit cost growth from FY13-FY17 is per the Independent Cost Estimate (ICE) completed for the Gate 6 Full Rate Production (FRP) Decision Review which was approved on May 1, 2012.

Increase in Block I Installation N/R cost growth in FY16 is per the Independent Cost Estimate (ICE) completed for the Gate 6 Full Rate Production (FRP) Decision Review which was approved on May 1, 2012.

Increase in Block I Equipment unit cost growth in FY13-FY17 is per the Independent Cost Estimate (ICE) completed for the Gate 6 Full Rate Production (FRP) Decision Review which was approved on May 1, 2012.

Increase in Block I Tech Upgrade Equipment unit cost growth in FY18 is per the Independent Cost Estimate (ICE) completed for the Gate 6 Full Rate Production (FRP) Decision Review which was approved on May 1, 2012.
Increase in VTT Equipment unit cost growth in FY14-FY17 is due to the projected unit cost growth to align with the schedule of the Block I effort (OSIP 008-10).
Does not include 8 Trainer installs.

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION:  Block I corrects Airborne Command Post program (ABNCP) Follow-On Operational Test and Evaluation (FOT&E) deficiencies to improve mission capability and readiness.  Modifications include, but not limited to: Block I; Very Low Frequency (VLF) Transmit Terminal (VTT); Technology Upgrade. 

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES:  Block I Systems Integration Lab (SIL) & aircraft (A/C) development kit installed in SIL FY06 and in A/C FY08; Milestone-C 3Q FY10; Low-Rate Initial Production (LRIP) contract award 3Q FY10; LRIP 1 kit buy in FY10 and 3 kit buys in FY11 with installs in FY11 and FY12 (4 A/C); Full-Rate Production (FRP) Decision Review achieved FY12.  FRP kit buys FY12-FY17 (11 A/C) with installs in FY13 - FY18 (15 A/C).  VTT Prototype SIL and A/C development kit delivery in FY11 with installation in FY12.  SIL and A/C testing 2Q FY12 to 1Q FY13.  VTT Production kit buys in FY13 - FY17 with installs in FY13-FY18 (15 A/C).  Technology Upgrade NRE in FY15 with NRE kit buy in FY16 and installation in FY16. Production kit buys in FY16-FY18 with installs in FY16-FY18.  

Note:  The VTT modification was moved from the Auxiliary Power Unit OSIP 002-12 (formerly Block Recapture) to the Block I OSIP 008-10.

Name.@footnote: The cost increase in Support Data from FY13 to FY14 is due to additional scope scheduled in FY14. The E-6B MR-TCDL integration in FY14 includes execution of Systems Integration Lab (SIL) systems testing and installation in the NRE aircraft, performance of flight test readiness reviews, and execution of aerodynamic flight test and performance flight testing. There is a significant increase in the scope of data being delivered by the contractor during these events to support execution of NAVAIR flight clearance and test requirements. In addition, Logistics Management Information (LMI) Summary data is being delivered, to include maintenance plans, initial support items list, support equipment requirements list, computer resource requirements, and facility requirements information.  This information is required to plan and execute operational testing in FY14/15. All contribute to increases in data support above OSD/OMB inflation rates.
Increase in Training Equipment cost in FY16 is to support the MR-TCDL training efforts.

The cost increase in Integrated Logistics Support (ILS) from FY13 to FY14 is due to additional scope scheduled in FY14. E-6B MR-TCDL integration in FY14 includes execution of Systems Integration Lab (SIL) systems testing and installation in the NRE aircraft, performance of flight test readiness reviews, and execution of aerodynamic flight test and performance flight testing. There is a significant increase in the scope of data being delivered by the contractor during these events to support execution of NAVAIR flight clearance and test requirements. In addition, Logistics Management Information (LMI) Summary data is being delivered, to include maintenance plans, initial support items list, support equipment requirements list, computer resource requirements, and facility requirements information. This information is required to plan and execute operational testing in FY14/15. All contribute to increases in ILS support above OSD/OMB inflation rates.

Increase in Other Support cost growth in FY13-FY14 is to support the Installation N/R effort and NRE kit buy in FY13 and installation in FY14.  The cost growth in FY17-FY18 is to support the continued kit buy in FY17 and installation in FY18.
Increase in MR-TCDL Kit unit cost growth in FY16-FY17 is per cost estimates for future contract award.
Increase in Installation Kits N/R cost for FY13 is due to the MR-TCDL program non-recurring effort (NRE) continuing in support of a NRE Kit buy in FY13.
Increase in MR-TCDL Equipment unit cost growth in FY16-FY17 is per cost estimates for future contract award.

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION:  Multi-Role Tactical Common Data Link (MR-TCDL) installs expanded aircraft communication bandwidth capability required to interoperate with United States Strategic Command's distributed National Command and Control Architecture.  Modification includes: MR-TCDL.

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES:  MR-TCDL contract award FY12; non-recurring engineering (NRE) in FY12-FY13 with NRE aircraft kit buy in FY13 and installation in FY14.  Production kit buys in FY15-FY17, with installs FY16 to FY18 (16 aircraft). 

Note:  The Family of Advanced Beyond-Line-of-Sight Terminals/Presidential and National Voice Conferencing (FAB-T/PNVC) modification was moved from the Multi-Role Tactical Common Data Link (MR-TCDL) OSIP 013-10 (formerly Block II) to a new OSIP 014-14 titled FAB-T/PNVC starting in FY14.

Name.@footnote: Increase in APU Data cost growth in FY14, FY15 & FY17 is due to the projected cost growth to align with the schedule of the Block I effort (OSIP 008-10).
Increase in APU Support Equipment unit cost growth in FY15 is due to the projected unit cost growth to align with the schedule of the Block I effort (OSIP 008-10).
Increase in APU Other Support cost growth in FY18 is due to the projected cost growth to align with the schedule of the Block I effort (OSIP 008-10).
Increase in APU Kit unit cost growth in FY15 & FY17 is due to the projected unit cost growth to align with the schedule of the Block I effort (OSIP 008-10).
Increase in APU Equipment unit cost growth in FY15 & FY17 is due to the projected unit cost growth to align with the schedule of the Block I effort (OSIP 008-10).

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION:  Auxiliary Power Unit (APU) corrects Airborne Command Post (ABNCP) Follow-On Operational Test (FOT&E) deficiencies by installing an improved APU to meet increased aircraft power requirements.  Modifications includes: APU.

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES:  Development FY09-FY13.  Prototype aircraft development kit delivered FY11 with installation in FY13.  APU production kit buys FY14-FY18 with installs in FY15 to beyond the Fiscal Years Defense Plan (15 aircraft).

Note:  The VTT modification was moved from the Auxiliary Power Unit (APU) OSIP 002-12 (formerly Block Recapture) to the Block I OSIP 008-10 starting in FY13.

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION:  Family of Advanced Beyond-Line-of-Sight Terminals/Presidential and National Voice Conferencing (FAB-T/PNVC) replaces obsolete Military Strategic Tactical Relay terminals with improved FAB-T, and installs PNVC to provide specialized secure voice capability over the strategic Advanced Extremely High Frequency satellite communications (SATCOM) system.  This modification includes, but not limited to: FAB-T; PNVC. 

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES:  FAB-T and PNVC contract award FY14.  Lab Kit buy and install in FY15.  Non-recurring engineering (NRE) in FY14-FY16 with NRE kit buy in FY16 and installation in FY16; production kit buys in FY17 to beyond the Future Years Defense Plan (FYDP) (15 A/C), with installs in FY18 and beyond the FYDP (16 A/C).  

Note:  The Family of Advanced Beyond-Line-of-Sight Terminals/Presidential and National Voice Conferencing (FAB-T/PNVC) modification was moved from the Multi-Role Tactical Common Data Link (MR-TCDL) OSIP 013-10 (formerly Block II) to a new OSIP 014-14 titled FAB-T/PNVC.
